edu.umass.cs.msocket

Class MServerSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.ServerSocket
      • edu.umass.cs.msocket.MServerSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class MServerSocket
extends ServerSocket
    This class implements the MSeverSocket. Applications can use MServerSoceket to start a server and start accepting connections.
    Author:
    aditya

      MServerSocket(String serverName, ProxySelectionPolicy proxyPolicy, SocketAddress endpoint, int backlog)
      Creates a new MServerSocket using the given GNS credentials and the default proxy policy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MServerSocket

        public MServerSocket()
              throws IOException
        Creates an unbound server socket.
        Throws:
        IOException - IO error when loading implementation

      • MServerSocket

        public MServerSocket(int port,
                     int backlog,
                     InetAddress bindAddr)
              throws IOException
        Create a server with the specified port, listen backlog, and local IP address to bind to. The bindAddr argument can be used on a multi-homed host for a ServerSocket that will only accept connect requests to one of its addresses. If bindAddr is null, it will default accepting connections on any/all local addresses. The port must be between 0 and 65535, inclusive. A port number of 0 means that the port number is automatically allocated, typically from an ephemeral port range. This port number can then be retrieved by calling getLocalPort. The backlog argument is the requested maximum number of pending connections on the socket. Its exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the parameter altogther. The value provided should be greater than 0. If it is less than or equal to 0, then an implementation specific default will be used.
        Parameters:
        port - - the port number, or 0 to use a port number that is automatically allocated.
        backlog - - requested maximum length of the queue of incoming connections.
        bindAddr - - the local InetAddress the server will bind to
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.

      • MServerSocket

        public MServerSocket(int port,
                     int backlog)
              throws IOException
        Creates a server socket and binds it to the specified local port number, with the specified backlog. A port number of 0 means that the port number is automatically allocated, typically from an ephemeral port range. This port number can then be retrieved by calling getLocalPort. The maximum queue length for incoming connection indications (a request to connect) is set to the backlog parameter. If a connection indication arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. The backlog argument is the requested maximum number of pending connections on the socket. Its exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the parameter altogther. The value provided should be greater than 0. If it is less than or equal to 0, then an implementation specific default will be used.
        Parameters:
        port - - the port number, or 0 to use a port number that is automatically allocated.
        backlog - - requested maximum length of the queue of incoming connections.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.

      • MServerSocket

        public MServerSocket(int port)
              throws IOException
        Creates a server socket, bound to the specified port. A port number of 0 means that the port number is automatically allocated, typically from an ephemeral port range. This port number can then be retrieved by calling getLocalPort. The maximum queue length for incoming connection indications (a request to connect) is set to 50. If a connection indication arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused.
        Parameters:
        port - - the port number, or 0 to use a port number that is automatically allocated.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.

      • MServerSocket

        public MServerSocket(String serverName)
              throws IOException
        Creates a new MServerSocket using the given GNS credentials, using no proxies, a random port number chosen automatically by the system. The given name is published in the GNS as an alias to be looked up by clients.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name to give to this socket in the GNS
        gnsCredentials - the GNS credentials to use to register the name in the GNS
        Throws:
        Exception
        IOException

      • MServerSocket

        public MServerSocket(String serverName,
                     ProxySelectionPolicy proxySelection)
              throws IOException
        Creates a new MServerSocket using the default GNS credentials, the given proxy policy and a random port number chosen automatically by the system. The given name is published in the GNS as an alias to be looked up by clients.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name to give to this socket in the GNS
        proxySelection - a ProxySelectionPolicy defining how to choose a proxy
        Throws:
        Exception
        IOException

      • MServerSocket

        public MServerSocket(String serverName,
                     ProxySelectionPolicy proxyPolicy,
                     SocketAddress endpoint,
                     int backlog)
              throws IOException
        Creates a new MServerSocket using the given GNS credentials and the default proxy policy. The given port number is bound locally. The given name is published in the GNS as an alias to be looked up by clients.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the service/server to register in the GNS
        serverPort - the port number to bind
        proxyPolicy - a ProxySelectionPolicy defining how to choose a proxy
        gnsCredentials - GNS credentials to use for this connection
        endpoint - The IP address & port number to bind to (null to let the system choose).
        backlog - The listen backlog length (0 for default)
        Throws:
        Exception - If NoProxyPolicy is used and the machine IP is behind a NAT
        IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes the MServerSocket, closes all accepted connections and frees the state. MServerSocket close doesn't close MobilityManagerServer
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • bind

        public void bind(String serverName,
                 SocketAddress endpoint,
                 int backlog)
          throws IOException
        Binds the MServerSocket to the given endpoint. The given name is published in the GNS as an alias to be looked up by clients using the given GNS credentials. Note that the endpoint should be an IP address reachable by clients.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the service/server to register in the GNS
        endpoint - The IP address & port number to bind to.
        backlog - The listen backlog length.
        gnsCredentials - GNS credentials to use for this connection
        Throws:
        Exception - If the socket is already bound
        IOException
        See Also:
        ServerSocket.bind(java.net.SocketAddress, int)

      • bind

        public void bind(SocketAddress endpoint,
                 int backlog)
          throws IOException
        Binds the socket to the address specified, since there is no name or GUID given, so the server is not registered in GNS, nor is connected to the proxies. Mainly, to support legacy operations.
        Overrides:
        bind in class ServerSocket
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        ServerSocket.bind(java.net.SocketAddress, int)

        public void migrate(InetAddress localAddress,
                    int localPort)
             throws IOException
        Migrates the server's listening address and also migrates all the already accepted connections using the current proxy selection policy.
        Parameters:
        localAddress - new local address to bind the listening socket
        localPort - new local port to bind the listening socket
        Throws:
        Exception - if no proxy can be found or the migration failed
